High dimensional mediation analysis.

Source: R/himaconf.R
himaconf.Rd

High dimensional mediation analysis with confounding adjustment. Methods of confounding adjustment include regression adjustment, propensity score adjustment, inverse probability weighting, overlapping weighting.

Usage

himaconf(
  X,
  M,
  Y,
  COV,
  k = 2,
  CONFmethod = c("RA", "PS", "IPW", "OW"),
  MTmethod = c("HIMA", "HIMA2"),
  tips = TRUE,
  simplify = TRUE
)

Arguments

X

Binary exposure.

M

High dimensional mediators.

Y

Continuous outcome.

COV

Covariates, also called confounders.

k

SIS parameter.

CONFmethod

Method of confounding adjustments, including RA,PS,IPW,OW.

MTmethod

Method of mediation testing, including HIMA, HIMA2.

tips

Whether to output message.

simplify

Only output mediator which p value less than 0.05.

Value

A dataframe contain mediators' point estimate and p value.

Examples

library(mydemo)
dat <- sim_data(n = 300, p = 2000)
X <- dat$X
Y <- dat$Y
M <- dat$M
COV <- dat$COV
himaconf(X, M, Y, COV, CONFmethod = "OW", MTmethod = "HIMA2")
#> Step 1: Sure Independent Screening ...  (2025-02-06 00:51:45.937636)
#> Step 2: DLasso Penalized Estimation ...   (2025-02-06 00:51:49.668616)
